reviews.title: Best burger in Toronto
text: I am not from Toronto, but I eat dinner here seriously every time I am in town, and they make the best burger at any restaurant I’ve been to. The koreatown is my go-to! Can’t stress it enough: amazing burgers!! Not to mention, the beer selection is actually really great. There’s always something from one of my favourite breweries, like an Elora sour. Ugh, amazing! Thanks so much Tallboys. Always a fun and welcoming environment. Also — trivia nights!! So fun.

reviews.title: Over-hyped? Not at all it's absolutely brilliant food and beer!
text: This was a first visit for me. I’m a regular visitor to Toronto to watch hockey and other sports. I always plan my visits methodically and this time managed to find the time to travel to and visit Tallboys.
From downtown it’s about 15-20 minutes on the subway, but don’t let that put you off.
When you get off the subway it’s only a few minutes’ walk. It’s quite an unassuming place so take care you don’t walk past, as a I did.
My visit was prior to a Leafs game, so I got in at opening time which is 4pm.
It was only me in there plus the owner and 1 of the bar staff.
The selection is quite large – as you’d expect, mostly Tallboys in the fridge. However, I decided to try some of the draught ales they had on and they were really very good.

I also decided to have some food and it just happened that the day I was in the burgers were on the special. I’d read so much about how good these were I decided to try them. I’d skipped lunch earlier in the day so was hungry too. Well I’m glad I listened to all the great reviews and suggestions. It was without doubt the best burger I have had anywhere! It was pretty big and with the obligatory fries set me up for a few more beers.

I decided to stick to the draught ales and had 3 in the end (pints) along with my burger. I sat at the bar chatting away to the 2 people in there (who were great people too) and I could have stayed in much longer. When it comes to great beer and food V The Leafs, then no matter how good it is the hockey will always win out so I had to cut my visit short.
Unfortunately, my itinerary for the rest of my stay meant I didn’t get chance to go out there again, but it is now firmly on my list of places to visit every time I’m in T.O.

If you don’t believe all the hype about how good a beer and burger could be, go try for yourself. Just like me you’ll soon realise it’s all correct. It’s a shame it’s not closer to downtown but don’t let that put you off either. A short journey on the TTC and you’ll soon be there to go and check it out.
Finally, thanks for the great company on my visit to the 2 who spent their time chatting to me. Oh, and thanks for recommending the burger……………….

reviews.title: Beer place
text: I am on holidays and went twice to this great place. Good selection of beer, nice food and really friendly, smiling and helpful  staff.
If you are around have a try and you won't regret.

reviews.title: Best Burgers in Ontario!
text: Great spot to meet friends, have some tasty craft beers and delicious burgers & pub food!  Tom, the owner makes everyone feel welcome and appreciates his customers.  Great service, reasonable prices and large portions , makes this a must visit!  Enjoy!  Try the Ossington !

reviews.title: Late night visit with a surprise
text: Came here after a walk up Ossington. Nice end to a night with a selection of beer that was nice to see. Didn't try the food but it looked good. Small crowd but great atmosphere.

reviews.title: Nice surprise!
text: I am not familiar with this part of Blood West and was looking for a good spot to have lunch and a few beers. Walking along the street nothing seemed very busy or appealing until I came across Tall Boys and what a great find it was!

An amazing selection of craft beers either in cans or on tap and really delicious food, I had a black bean burrito which was awesome. The server was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. She said they're renovating which will be nice as it's a little run down looking.

reviews.title: For the beer lover
text: A little bit off the beaten track in Toronto, this place has everything that a beer lover would need, with friendly service and lots of craft beers on bottle and on tap.

reviews.title: Excellent food, beer and atmosphere
text: Tallboys is a relaxed place with dozens of local craft beer available with delicious food to boot. Watch the game, hang out with friends or sit at the bar and chat with the locals.

reviews.title: Cider & Beer
text: I have been once and enjoyed it as they have a good selection of both craft beer and cider.  Service was friendly and prompt - decor is fun, nice spot to chill at and down the street is the owner's sibling's place (I believe) Wenona also a great spot to check out.  Will be back and recommend.

reviews.title: A local bar which makes you feel like a local
text: A wonderful array of local craft beer attracted us to this spot which is located between  Christie Pits and the emerging but not bouchie Ossington and Bloor.  It has a casual atmosphere with well placed some televisions  - not so dominating that you would ever call this a sports bar.  The staff is friendly in the way of a neighbour who is familiar but who hasn't been introduced.  The beer selection is unbelievable.  A word about the food.  Bar food can be very routine and satisfying, but it is such a pleasure when the kitchen is actually producing bar food with the appropriate amount of reverence - when this happens, the food tastes like home cooking and not simply a bar menu habitué.  The food was very good.  I had the pulled pork sandwich - delicious.  The side salad was actually a really nice salad and not simply a garnish disguised as a sandwich.

reviews.title: Lots of beer... and good food.
text: You would expect a lot of good beer and Tallboys delivered.  Great options for local craft beers.  I was very surprised at the quality of the food.  I had a fantastic burger and fries.  I expected average pub food but it was much better than average.

reviews.title: Support Local!
text: Wonderful staff, really friendly, may not all know me by name, but most of the time I feel recognized and always get appropriate suggestions on what to try next from their wide and ever-changing selection of beers :)
And the food is good too, just the right kind of bar food.

Monday nights I think are movie trivia nights, happened to walk into the middle of one of these and it was packed! I think I knew the answer to 1 or 2 questions, but the teams involved seemed to appreciate the challenge.
I always have a good time here.
Go and leave a prepaid drink on the board they have behind the bar for a buddy or yourself, your later self will thank you..

reviews.title: Awesome beer, awesome food
text: I was staying with a friend just up the road and we wanted some food. We stumbled upon this place with it's fantastic range of beers (over 60) and awesome food and found ourselves coming back night after night.

Downside to the beers is that most of them come in cans, only a few (about 6?) are on draught. Because they are craft beers they are also quote expensive. $7 on a can of beer can seem quite a lot, but it is good quality.
The food we tried was all excellent, over the course of 2 weeks we tried at some point the wings (all manor of flavours), burgers, sweet potato fries, calamari and it was all excellent.
Worth a visit!

reviews.title: A "must try" family run business.
text: Our friend heard of this place and we gave it a try, wow! This is a small simply decorated place where you may end up table to table with other guests. Not a negative thing, you get first hand impressions of other craft beers and a peek at the menu items up close. Want to try a beer but not sure if you'll like it?  The waiter/owner happily brought us three smaller glasses to share a beer between us. The folks here really know their beers and there are a lot of choices so be prepared to ponder the menu for a while. Ok so now you're hungry, check out the menu, simple stuff like burgers; extraordinary burgers! We had the bleu burger with sweet potato fries and highly recommend it. Again our waiter/owner blew us away, no frozen patty here folks, local butcher (across the street) provides the ground beef and he's a picky butcher so you're getting great quality. Home made in house and prepared fresh to order makes the difference, not "just a burger". We left full and satisfied and promised to return, friendly knowledgeable staff/owners, great food and a huge beer selection await folks, give it a try!

reviews.title: Get the Grilled Cheese
text: This is a great little bar on Bloor near Ossington.  They offer a huge variety of tall boys, including cider options, as well as basic rail drinks and a full kitchen menu.  Their grilled cheese is made with a garlic thyme butter and it puts all other grilled cheese to shame.  The fries are super crispy and delicious.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu though.

reviews.title: Extensive beer list
text: Just a quick review, visited this place yesterday for the first time to meet an old friend. Sat by the window and enjoyed the fantastic views of random men smoking outside (not their fault to be fair, but annoying none the less). We each had two beers and I had a Caesar salad. Food was great but not super outstanding. It is a pub, after all.
I guess I was kinda off put by the attitude of the bar tender. Wasn't overly friendly, but wasn't rude. Just didn't seem to really be there, maybe just a rough day. Won't be back again.

reviews.title: Excellent Beer List
text: Tallboys is about a ten minute walk from my house. And I am so lucky. They have an awesome beer list (with plenty of new things always coming in) and great food. I love their fried chicken sandwich! The atmosphere is super warm and service is great.

reviews.title: Great evening with great service
text: Was up here with a few friends, had some laughs and the service was A1 from Laya. Had a great time. we'll be back.

reviews.title: Beer only!
text: Only dropped into have a quick pint.  Excellent assortment of bottles and cans.  Draught selection was rather limited.  Did not eat but the burgers served at the table beside us looked amazing.  Will have to go back and grab one next time.

reviews.title: Great selection of local craft beers.
text: Most of the selection of craft beers are in tall boy cans with a few worthy beers on tap. Comfortable surroundings on a quiet evening spent there.

reviews.title: Nice little sports bar
text: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat. Portabello burger was awesome, and I had the Chili taco. Was also very tasty. Service was exceptional, food was delivered quickly, and hot. Would stop in again.

reviews.title: A belgian on a beer tour in canada
text: As our beers are pretty good, we were very surprised to drink several really good beers here. We even took some home

reviews.title: fun, loud, tasty
text: Tallboys is fantastic for a wide selection of craft beers, great service, and good food. Always a friendly atmosphere and knowledgeable staff. I'd love some more vegetarian options, but the tofu sandwich is fabulous. It can get a bit loud as it's usually crowded, but I've always had fun.

reviews.title: Great find!
text: Walking to an event, needed some dinner and saw this place. It looked appealing, busy on a Thursday night, and thought it was a good sign.
Went in had a nice casual dinner, black bean tacos and salad, and fried chicken sandwich and fabulous fries. And beer!
